alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 11:10AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Volusia County through 1145 AM EDT... At 1110 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeLand, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach and DeLand. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
